Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix with high lip; dull cream slip; interior: lip glazed with red band near top; on wall three narrow bands and part of undetermined black-figure decoration; exterior: upper part of lip black, above myrtle-branch frieze; in handle zone part of horizontal handle palmette with red heart.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.526.p.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.14)
Stibbe 1972 / Lakonische Vasenmaler des sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. (p. 254-5, no. 253, pl. 87.1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 557, no. E30)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 396, no. E30)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 241, no. 30)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.34) (Phase 1)
